test_mode.purpose: Test short-selling mechanics and reasoning architecture
test_mode.notes: Small allocation for learning. Churn positions to validate system. Losses here are tuition.

sector_scan.notes: Agent should identify 2-3 candidates from struggling sectors, not fight strong trends

rules.notes: Small positions, tight stops, quick profits. This is practice, not alpha generation.

day_trade_management.notes: PDT rule: 4 day trades per 5 rolling days. Conserve by holding overnight when possible.

position_rules.notes: CRITICAL: Check if short already open before adding. Do NOT stack positions!

short_selling.notes: ACTIVE: Evaluate shorts each review but ONLY open if not already in position. Respect day trade limits.

options_trading.notes: Options via alpaca-options MCP server. Conservative strategies only. No naked options.

cash_reserve_floor.notes: If cash < 8%, trim best performer (if >25% gain) by 15%

fallback_rules.notes: Deterministic rules executed when Claude API unavailable. Provides basic portfolio protection.

defensive_mode.notes: Activated by circuit breaker. Closes losing positions and shorts, invokes agent for safe haven selection, uses tighter stops. Exits when loss recovers to <1% or new trading day.

overnight_gap_protection.notes: If portfolio opens down >2% from prior close, immediately trigger defensive mode. Protects against overnight gaps that bypass intraday circuit breaker.

vice_index.notes: Sin stocks tend to be defensive during tech selloffs. Low correlation to growth.

exit_conditions.notes: Exit rotation when 25% of positions flip to STRONG BUY or after 10 days max

rotation_trigger.notes: When 40%+ of tech positions show STRONG SELL, rotate into vice stocks. Sex, drugs, and rock & roll hold up when tech tanks. Return to tech when signals improve.
